title: China pushes for BRICS expansion to legitimize its vision of a new world order
summary: Through the BRICS and other international organizations it dominates, China has been strengthening its ties with 'Global South' countries, and offering an alternative to the US-dominated world order.

title: Israeli army confirms killing Hashem Safieddine, potential successor of Hezbollah chief Nasrallah
summary: On October 8, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that the military had 'taken out' Safieddine, without specifically naming him.

title: Rudy Giuliani ordered to turn over NYC apartment, luxury watches to Georgia election workers
summary: The former lawyer must turn over sports memorabilia and other prized possessions to two Georgia election workers who won a $148 million defamation judgment against him over his false ballot fraud claims related to the 2020 presidential election.

title: US Secretary of State urges Netanyahu to reach Gaza truce
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken, while in Israel on his 11th trip to the region since the October 7 attack, 'underscored the need to capitalise' on Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's death to push for a ceasefire, as well as improve Gaza's humanitarian aid access.

title: Biodiversity: Sharing the benefits of genetic resources, a sensitive issue at COP16
summary: The countries gathering in Colombia need to make progress on establishing compensation mechanisms for the use of plant or animal genomes, which are currently stored in freely accessible databases.

title: The Conquista, a source of pride and shame
summary: A dispute with Mexico, which demands an apology from the King of Spain, controversy over the meaning of the national holiday and decolonization within national museums... Spain is entangled in the legacy of the conquest of the Americas.

title: Trump calls Harris 'lazy as hell,' VP says Democrats are prepared if former president declares victory prematurely
summary: With 14 days before Election Day, VP Kamala Harris was spending Tuesday in meetings in Washington, DC, and was scheduled to record TV interviews. The former Republican president was campaigning in North Carolina.

title: One death and dozens sick after severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder in several US States
summary: The outbreak, which began in late September, spans 10 western states with most of the 49 cases concentrated in Colorado and Nebraska, the CDC said.

title: Former Abercrombie CEO charged with sex crimes
summary: Ex-CEO Mike Jeffries, his partner Matthew Smith and the pair's fixer James Jacobson allegedly groomed aspiring male models to attend sex parties around the world, at which victims were plied with alcohol and drugs and assaulted.

title: Fleeing war, Israelis in Greece try to regain a semblance of 'normal life'
summary: Since October 7, several hundred Israeli families have found refuge in Greece, a country that offers them the choice of several kinds of visas.

title: UK and Germany to sign a defense pact to counter Russia's threat
summary: Defense ministers from Britain and Germany will sign the agreement in London on Wednesday.

title: Victor Wembanyama, the face of an ever more French NBA
summary: The North American league's 2024-2025 season kicks off on Tuesday. Along with the Spurs star, the French contingent now includes Zaccharie Risacher and Alexandre Sarr, number one and two picks in the latest draft.

title: A sixth sense discovered in geckos
summary: Saccules, vesicles in the inner ear, enable the lizard to 'hear' soundless vibrations at very low frequencies.

title: Israel attacks Hezbollah's financial system in Lebanon
summary: On Sunday, Israeli strikes targeted the Al-Qard Al-Hassan financial organization, known for distributing microloans within the Shiite community. On Monday, as US envoy Amos Hochstein was in Beirut to propose a new ceasefire plan, Israeli bombings killed 10.

title: In the Dominican Republic, mass migrant expulsions turn into a 'hunt for Haitians'
summary: On October 2, the Dominican government announced a campaign to expel 10,000 immigrants a week. It's aimed primarily at the country's large Haitian community, but concerns are being raised over the growing number of arrests deemed arbitrary.

title: Harris and Trump in a tense, uncertain battle two weeks before election
summary: Evenly matched in the polls, the two candidates are focusing on a limited number of swing states. While Kamala Harris enjoys a clear financial advantage, this doesn't guarantee anything, as demonstrated by Hillary Clinton in 2016.

title: Gold rush: 'In 1994, it was worth €8,000 a kilo. Now it's €73,000'
summary: The precious metal is considered a safe haven in times of uncertainty, crisis and armed conflict.

title: French mass rape trial: 'The idea of the monster rapist has protected countless criminals in overalls, ties and robes'
summary: The Pelicot trial is already a landmark in the history of feminism according to historian Christine Bard, who retraces the struggles that led to the systemic nature of sexual violence being revealed.

title: Is there too much noise for our children?
summary: At school, in the cafeteria, on the street, and sometimes at home too, the noise levels to which children are exposed are high, leading to stress and fatigue.

title: The Museum of Modern Art in Troyes gets a facelift
summary: Closed for renovation in 2018, the museum is now home to various collections, including the beautiful one by Pierre and Denise Lévy.

title: Kazakhstan's Caspian Sea is drying up, with disastrous consequences
summary: The Caspian Sea's water levels have dropped over the past 20 years, especially in the north, shared by Russia and Kazakhstan. The decline threatens biodiversity, and severely impacts the Kazakh fishing, transport, tourism and even hydrocarbon sectors.

title: LeBron, Bronny James make NBA history with father-son appearance
summary: The Los Angeles Lakers opened their campaign against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Tuesday.

title: Women confronting separation during cancer: 'It was the most traumatic experience of my life'
summary: Women are six times more likely than men to experience a romantic break-up during cancer or other serious illness.

title: Turkey's Açik Radyo, the radio station for 'all the voices in the universe,' goes silent
summary: The Turkish Radio and Television Supreme Council canceled the 30-year-old independent radio station's broadcasting license after a program referred to 'the Armenian genocide.'

title: 'Seen from Europe, Trump's 'discursive style' is not only confusing, it's completely off the rails'
summary: The Republican candidate is not the first populist in the US, but he has broken the rules observed by his predecessors 30 years ago. His possible re-election on November 5 would profoundly unsettle the democratic system, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Ukrainian prosecutor general resigns amid corruption scandals
summary: Judges and other civil servants are said to have improperly obtained disability certificates, enabling them to earn extra income and, potentially, avoid conscription.

title: How the war in Ukraine is accelerating international use of the yuan
summary: Having stepped up its trade with Russia, which is under Western sanctions, China is promoting the use of national currencies in order to circumvent the dollar's dominance.

title: The new era of hacktivism
summary: This form of online activism, popularized by Anonymous, has been making a strong comeback in recent years. Its growth has notably been driven by governments, who see it as an ideal way of operating undercover.

title: Fethullah Gülen's movement faces uncertain future
summary: Gülen, a preacher and opposition figure who died on October 21, founded Hizmet in the 1960s. Tens of thousands of its members fled to the US, Germany and Africa after the failed coup against President Erdogan on July 15, 2016.

title: US says 'now is the time' to end Gaza war
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Israel to avoid further escalation with Iran. Israel is fighting Iran-backed Hamas in Gaza and Hezbollah in Lebanon and has pledged to hit back against Iran's October 1 missile strike.

title: At the French mass rape trial, defendants are given rare a chance to reflect on their actions and responsibility
summary: By describing some of Dominique Pelicot's 50 co-defendants as 'manipulable subjects,' psychiatrist François Amic put the main accused back at the center of the trial. The argument about the need to individualize his co-defendants resurfaced.

title: French mass rape trial: 'The shame isn't ours to feel, it's theirs,' says Gisèle Pelicot
summary: Gisèle Pelicot took the stand on Wednesday to discuss the evidence presented so far in the Vaucluse criminal court, with her ex-husband and the main accused Dominique Pelicot watching from the dock.

title: Wendy Sherman: Russia's 'main purpose is to sow division in the United States'
summary: An advisor to Kamala Harris on international issues, the Democratic diplomat is convinced that Vladimir Putin is trying to influence the US presidential election.

title: Obama raps with Eminem to rally support for Harris in Detroit
summary: Eminem introduced the former president at a rally in Detroit on Tuesday, before Obama started quoting lines from the rapper's hit 'Lose Yourself.'

title: Greek PM condemns most difficult climate year in four decades
summary: The number of wildfires so far this year in Greece has reached 9,101, up from 7,163 last year, with 109,000 acres burnt, Kyriakos Mitsotakis said during a parliamentary debate on the matter.
